overview: The purpose of this Act is to establish a three-year women's court pilot program in the circuit court of the second, third, and fifth circuits. [1] The pilot program is intended to acknowledge the distinct pathways that lead women into the criminal justice system and address their individualized needs. [1] The judiciary shall submit a report of its findings and recommendations regarding the program, and the Act shall be repealed on June 30, 2028. [1] [1]
appropriations: There is appropriated out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii an unspecified sum for fiscal year 2025-2026 and the same sum for fiscal year 2026-2027. [1] The funds are for equipment; mental health, substance abuse treatment, and other services; and the establishment of seven temporary positions. [1] These positions include social worker V, social worker IV, circuit court clerk II, and judicial clerk positions. [1]
assumptions_and_methodology: The fiscal impact is based on the establishment of a three-year women's court pilot program within the second, third, and fifth circuits. [1] Costs are associated with funding for equipment, mental health and substance abuse treatment services, and the establishment of seven temporary positions. [1] The specific dollar amount for these costs is not provided in the bill. [1]
agency_impact: There is established within the second, third, and fifth circuits of the judiciary the women's court pilot program. [1] The judiciary will be responsible for expending the appropriated sums for the purposes of this Act. [1] The judiciary shall also submit a report of its findings and recommendations to the governor and legislature prior to the regular sessions of 2026, 2027, and 2028. [1]
economic_impact: The goal of the program is diverting participants from incarceration, supporting their success in the community, and reducing recidivism. [1] Research reflects that for women, histories of abuse, trauma, poverty, mental illness, substance use disorders, and unhealthy relationships intersect with their entry into criminal behavior. [1] Women offenders also face unique barriers to success after incarceration, such as being primary caregivers and lacking stable work history, which the program's services are designed to address. [1] [1]
policy_impact: This Act builds upon Act 243, Session Laws of Hawaii 2022, which established a three-year women's court pilot program in the circuit court of the first circuit. [1] This bill establishes a temporary three-year woman's court pilot program within the second, third, and fifth circuits. [1] This Act shall take effect on July 1, 2025, and shall be repealed on June 30, 2028. [1]
revenue_sources: There is appropriated out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii the sum necessary for the program. [1] The bill does not identify any other revenue sources. [1] The sums appropriated shall be expended by the judiciary. [1]
six_year_fiscal_implications: This Act establishes a three-year women's court pilot program that takes effect on July 1, 2025, and is repealed on June 30, 2028. [1] It appropriates an unspecified sum out of the general revenues for fiscal year 2025-2026 and the same sum for fiscal year 2026-2027. [1] The appropriated funds are for equipment, mental health services, substance abuse treatment, and other services. [1] The appropriation also covers the establishment of seven temporary positions. [1] These positions are full-time equivalent social worker V positions, social worker IV positions, circuit court clerk II positions, and judicial clerk positions. [1] The bill does not specify funding for the third year of the pilot program, FY 2027-2028. [1] The judiciary is required to submit annual reports in 2026, 2027, and 2028. [1] These reports will include recommendations as to whether the pilot program should continue, expand, provide additional services, or be discontinued. [1] There are no specified fiscal implications beyond the repeal date of June 30, 2028. [1] Any future costs would depend on subsequent legislation based on the program's evaluation. [1]
operating_revenue_impact: The bill does not anticipate any impact on operating revenues. [1] The program is funded through an appropriation from the general revenues of the State of Hawaii. [1] No fees or other revenue-generating mechanisms are mentioned in the Act. [1]
capital_expenditure_impact: The appropriation includes funding for equipment. [1] The bill does not specify the type of equipment or any major capital investments. [1] The primary expenditures are for services and temporary positions. [1]
fiscal_implications_after_6_years: This Act shall be repealed on June 30, 2028. [1] The judiciary's final report will include recommendations as to whether the women's court pilot program should be continued, expanded, or discontinued. [1] Any fiscal implications after the three-year pilot program would be contingent upon future legislation. [1]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: A previous fiscal note was not provided in the source documents.
